qas.question: Historians trace the earliest Baptist church back to when?
Historians trace the earliest Baptist church back to where?
Who was the pastor of the earliest Baptist church?
John Smyth broke his ties with what church?
Where did John Smyth go into exile?
Who was the pastor of the earliest Christian church?
Where was the first Christian church with John Smyth as the pastor located?
In what year did Smyth baptize himself for the second time?
Historians trace the oldest Protestant church to where?

context: Historians trace the earliest Baptist church back to <a0_0>1609<a0_0/> in <a1_0><b6_0><b9_0>Amsterdam<b9_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>, with <a2_0><b5_0>John Smyth<b5_0/><a2_0/> as its pastor. Three years earlier, while a Fellow of Christ's College, Cambridge, he had broken his ties with the Church of England. Reared in the <a3_0>Church of <b8_0>England<b8_0/><a3_0/>, he became "Puritan, English Separatist, and then a Baptist Separatist," and ended his days working with the Mennonites. He began meeting in England with 60–70 English Separatists, in the face of "great danger." The persecution of religious nonconformists in England led Smyth to go into exile in <a4_0>Amsterdam<a4_0/> with fellow Separatists from the congregation he had gathered in Lincolnshire, separate from the established church (Anglican). Smyth and his lay supporter, Thomas Helwys, together with those they led, broke with the other English exiles because Smyth and Helwys were convinced they should be baptized as believers. In <b7_0>1609<b7_0/> Smyth first baptized himself and then baptized the others.
